channel.title: Nooby question
channel.description: Ok. I am relatively new to Java but I needed to ask a question. When coding a source among all the different ones on the web...do all sources have to follow a specific standard layout to make a runescape source work or are all sources able to be coded differently with variables, layout, and names associated with dataTypes etc...Just a question.

item.title: Nooby question
item.dc:creator: @dogzound5 dogzound5@gmail.com
item.description:
@dogzound5 wrote:

I found java for dummies and downloaded it lol. I am sure it will help me a lot. Thanks for the constructive criticism

Read full topic

item.title: Nooby question
item.dc:creator: @ricky_james ricky james
item.description:
@ricky_james wrote:

[quote=“SandScape, post:5, topic:260439”][quote author=ricky james link=topic=343868.msg2655308#msg2655308 date=1233804207]

[quote author=dogzound5@gmail.com link=topic=343868.msg2655306#msg2655306 date=1233804138]
Well I need help because I know how to code Java in theory but in these runescape sources I am thrown off because either it is just too complex for my level or it is just wierd because of all the different names and ints thrown in my face that I have no clue what to do with in reference to the rest of the source. I know how to create shops, items, add models, ints etc…but I am talking about changing wildy levels, or fixing wierd glitches, or like making complex additions to code already.
[/quote]If your looking for something to read to learn to code go to www.google.com and search java for dummies and dl
[/quote]yeah that should help…isnt that kind of harsh tho[/quote]No,good book will help him plenty.

Read full topic
